explanations.nonLinearSquare: The system is non-linear because the x[n]^2 term violates the additivity principle.
explanations.causalPastInput: The system is causal because output depends only on past and present inputs.
explanations.unstableRamp: The system is unstable because the ramp function grows without bound.
explanations.memoryPastInput: The system has memory because output depends on past input values.
explanations.memorylessCurrent: The system is memoryless because output depends only on current input.
explanations.timeInvariant: The system is time-invariant because time shifts in input produce identical shifts in output.
explanations.timeVariant: The system is time-variant because the system parameters change with time.

signalDescriptions.unitStep: The unit step function u(t) is 0 for t < 0 and 1 for t ≥ 0.
signalDescriptions.unitImpulse: The Dirac delta function δ(t) is zero everywhere except at t = 0, where it is infinite.
signalDescriptions.sinusoidal: A sinusoidal signal of the form A·sin(ωt + φ), where A is amplitude, ω is angular frequency, and φ is phase.
signalDescriptions.exponential: An exponential signal of the form A·e^(αt), where A is amplitude and α determines growth/decay.
signalDescriptions.ramp: The ramp function r(t) is 0 for t < 0 and t for t ≥ 0.
